            us. It is part of our foundation, along with all the beautiful and courageous aspects.

action_step:
Our government, as well as all of us as individuals, need to recognize this injustice, empathize, and feel
            the hurt of and to these people, as part of our collective healing process. It is only when we –
            individually and collectively – are willing to do this, will this trauma be healed. I applaud Biden for
            taking a step in that direction. And I’m glad that the Interior Department, which oversees 500 million acres
            of land – one fifth of the country – is in the hands of a person who understands the deep inter-relationship
            between humans and the land we live on.
journal_entry: Write about your awareness of the past and present treatment of our Native American brothers and sisters.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Any effort to awaken to how our country has treated its indigenous population – and
            empathize with their hurt - is a step in your contribution to our national healing. As well as your own.
            That puts you on The Path.
quote: "You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don't try." -Beverly Sills

step_of_the_day.title:
Find a way to move forward with your goals. There are many reasons not to take action. Today find reasons to
            act (Pillar #9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Today’s step is straight-forward: What do you want and how are you going to get it/there? If you are having
            any difficulty, it’s usually due to focusing on what can go wrong; how it won’t work out. If this is your
            tendency, there will always be something that gets in your way. Those who are successful have the same
            things that might go wrong; the same possible opportunities for rejection, or failure. They just don’t focus
            in that direction. They look for and expect success.

action_step:
Identify what you want and an action that will move you in that direction. Focus on how your action can lead
            to success. Focus on how it can work out. And then focus on the positive results. Give yourself space to
            notice the feelings associated with this success. And finally, commit to taking action today in line with
            this.
journal_entry: Write about your own resistance to taking action, and how you can do it differently today.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Take a moment to appreciate your effort to take action yesterday. No matter the
            particular result, if you overcame resistance and made the effort, that put you on The Path.
quote: “Culture is the widening of the mind and of the spirit.” —JaWaharlal Nehru

step_of_the_day.title: Learn something today about indigenous cultures (Pillar #3)
step_of_the_day.content:
The Garifuna International Indigenous Film Festival (GIIFF) takes audiences and moviegoers on a global
            journey, celebrating culture through film, documentaries, musical performances, art, sculpting, fashion, and
            dance. The films presented over the years have shown the plight, the fight for survival, and the injustices
            brought upon indigenous cultures and societies around the world. But the most important aspect of the film
            festival is how it also brings the culture and the wisdom of indigenous societies to prominence in order for
            all of us to appreciate and learn important lessons. Many of these lessons have been lost, as we
            automatically believe that the “new” is better. But wisdom is realizing that no one culture has a monopoly
            on the truth.
            Go to www.GarifunaFilmFestival.com to learn more.

action_step:
Go to the website of the Garifuna Film Festival (www.GarifunaFilmFestival. com), or find other avenues to
            educate yourself about the gifts of the indigenous peoples of our human family.
journal_entry: Write about your awareness of indigenous cultures and how this has impacted you.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you take any time to learn something about indigenous cultures. They have much
            to teach us. Stay on The Path.
quote: "I would rather die of passion than of boredom." Vincent van Gogh

step_of_the_day.title:
Connecting with your passion and your excitement. You will learn better if your efforts are accompanied by
            positive emotions (Pillar #6)
step_of_the_day.content:
The statements I wrote above, make two important points for today’s step. The first is that when you
            experience passion and excitement, this puts you on The Path. It helps you engage more deeply with life. And
            the second is that when you touch into your passion and excitement, whatever you are trying to learn, you
            will learn faster and better. This has been demonstrated in countless research studies. This positive
            activation you bring to the process mobilizes your brain to be more focused and effective in growing.

action_step:
Identify something that you are passionate about today. Appreciate and let yourself feel the excitement
            associated with this passion. Apply this energy to some learning or training that you are currently involved
            in to advance your passion.
journal_entry: Write about the passion you have and how it helps to animate your life.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Did you connect with your passion yesterday? Stay on The Path.
quote: "Love the life you live. Live the life you love." Bob Marley

step_of_the_day.title: What do you love about the life you are living. Identifying what makes you happy (Pillar #6)
step_of_the_day.content:
It might seem strange to be talking about the life you love during this terrible crisis we are all going
            through. We are in lock down, unable to do so many of the things we enjoy. Many of us have been touched by
            death and illness as well as economic hardship. It can be very daunting. While upset and upsetting feelings should not be ignored, it is also important to find a way to balance the
            hardship with the reasons for being alive. I have talked about the value of positive emotions. Including how
            they actually improve the functioning of your heart. I have also shared that the Dalai Lama has said that
            the purpose of life is to be happy.

action_step:
Find something to be happy about today. Identify what you love about the life you are living and take a
            moment to appreciate it.
journal_entry: Write about what you love about your life and what you do to bring that more into your life.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: What did you find to be happy about in your life? Find The Path. It will make you
            happy.
quote: "Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning." Gloria Steinem

step_of_the_day.title:
Today take some time to dream about a world in which there is Peace. If we all take time to dream and
            visualize Peace on earth, on Christmas day, the effort will have a positive impact (Pillar #3)
step_of_the_day.content:
The Global Consciousness Project was started at Princeton University by Roger Nelson. The project collects
            data from random number generators (RNG), (RNGs are machines that generate random numbers, separate from any
            influence) from around the world. It’s a way of studying mind-matter interactions. The idea is that if there
            is a powerful enough event that is simultaneously felt by many people around the world, this “synchronized\"
            experience might impact the output from the RNGs. If this occurred, it would be evidence of a global
            consciousness and the impact of consciousness on matter. In other words, these generators could be used as sensing devices that detect the summated consciousness of
            large populations if such a thing exists. Dean Radin, Chief Scientist at the Institute of Noetic Sciences
            has published numerous findings that demonstrate this phenomenon actual happens. He coined the term
            “electrogaiagram\" because the idea is like an electroencephalogram, where you put electrodes around the
            head – except here they were monitoring the “head\" of Gaia, the planet itself. One such study looked at the output from these RNGs before and after the terrorist attacks of 9/11. These
            studies have clearly demonstrated that this and similar events change the outputs of the RNG. In fact, they
            determined that the odds against these results occurring by chance was about 3 trillion to one. Clearly
            something real was happening.

action_step:
Today, for five minutes, clear your mind, engage in relaxed breathing, and visualize world Peace in any way
            that works for you.
journal_entry: Write about your prayers for peace in the world and peace in your own lives.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: This was yesterday’s “step\": “Today, for five minutes, clear your mind, engage in
            relaxed breathing, and visualize world Peace in any way that works for you.\" I hope you took this step and
            contributed to this lofty goal.
quote: "Nothing is impossible, the word itself says, ‘I'm possible!" - Audrey Hepburn

step_of_the_day.title: Focusing on what’s possible, helps bring it into reality (Pillars # 1-9)
step_of_the_day.content:
We are all familiar with Newtonian physics. This is our everyday reality and experience, where time goes in
            one direction, you can’t be in two places at the same time and there is separation of observer from what’s
            observed. But there is another reality – quantum reality. On the quantum, or micro-reality level, these
            rules of physics appear to break down. There is non-duality and the observer directly influences
            reality.Science is still trying to figure how these two very different versions of reality come together. But on a
            psychological level, I believe there is considerable overlap. Goals are more likely to be achieved when you
            believe they are going to happen. You are more likely to achieve success when you believe in yourself. In
            other words, your belief – and more specifically, your belief in yourself, leads to positive results,
            success, and happiness.

action_step:
Start off this week with a declaration of your beliefs in yourself. As you do this remember two things: 1)
            The declaration itself, engages a process in your brain that supports its reality and 2) the more you
            declare, the more strength the belief develops.
journal_entry: Write about your beliefs in yourself. As well as any resistance you have to this process.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you declare your belief in yourself? This sets up the conditions for your
            success. This is The Path
quote:
“One can only be in the freedom of the current moment by letting go of the suffering of the past.\" Dr.
            Liana Mattulich

step_of_the_day.title: Let go of what holds you back. Eliminating some of your suffering (Pillar #6)
step_of_the_day.content:
While we experience the impact of our childhood and how we were treated, we are also held back by
            internalizing the negative messages we have unconsciously taken in. These messages of not being good enough,
            and frequent self-criticism, create self-inflicted wounds that need to be overcome. It’s easy to hold
            beliefs about ourselves without realizing that they are not necessary.

action_step:
Identify one of the negative messages you give yourself. Make the decision that treating yourself this way
            is harmful and must stop. Then, shift into the voice of your healthy internal parent and speak from this
            place of love, acceptance, compassion and support. Decide to make these messages your new way of treating
            yourself. Create an affirmation to support this effort.
journal_entry: Write about how you want to treat yourself.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: give yourself credit for all your efforts to heal, grow and become a better person
            last year. Allow all your efforts to strengthen your foundation and your trust in yourself. Be on The Path.
quote:
“When you begin to dream, you set universal forces in motion that support these dreams.\" Stephen
            Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Begin your planning, dreaming and intentions for 2021. Start your New Year off with positive intentions and
            goals (Pillars #1-9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Today is a good day for “new beginnings\". It’s the start of a new year. It’s the ending of a very difficult
            year. Some refer to “new year’s resolutions\". And many of us have bad memories of not following through
            with these resolutions in the past.In the next few days, I’ll take you through a process to identify past mistakes, wrong turns, decisions and,
            well, simply not following through. You want to learn from these experiences and be better able to find and
            be on The Path.

action_step:
Let’s begin the establishment of a plan, a mapping and finding The Path by visualizing some of the things
            you want for this year. To begin with, it’s not necessary to know the details of your plan or goals. Today,
            simply dream and visualize.
journal_entry: Write down what comes up for you in this visualization, dreaming and goal setting process.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did the identification of your dreams and goals for the new year inspire you? Did
            they raise concerns of your ability to pull them off? Stay positive; stay on The Path. These ongoing steps
            will support your success.
quote:
“At the moment of commitment, the entire universe conspires to assist you\" - Johann Wolfgang von
            Goethe

step_of_the_day.title: Pick important goals in each of the 9 pillars of Resilience and Success for 2021 (Pillars #1-9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Take a moment to meditate on the quote from Goethe. What a powerful statement: at the moment of commitment,
            the entire universe conspires to assist you. Each part is important. First is commitment. The stronger your
            commitment, the greater will be the support from the universe. Your level of commitment determines the level
            of “buy-in\" you will get from the universe. That’s powerful! You can trace your successes directly back to
            your level of commitment.I have found this to be true in my own life. When I have put my whole self into a project, an idea, and went
            out into the world, I felt like the universe aligned to support my efforts. People contacted me; synergistic
            events happened. And what’s most interesting about this process is that I might put out energy in one
            direction, and the rewards would come back from a totally different source.

action_step: Here are the 9 pillars of Resilience and Success:Relationship with selfRelationship with othersRelationship with something greaterPhysical balance and masteryMental balance and masteryEmotional balance and masteryPresenceFlexibilityPower – the ability to get things doneFor detailed descriptions of each of these pillars you can go to my website:www.DrStephenSideroff.com.
journal_entry: Write about how you treat your commitments and any intention to be better at holding to them in 2021.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Congratulations for identifying how you want to grow within each of the 9 pillars of
            resilience and success. We will refer back to these periodically. This puts you on The Path.
quote:
“The moment one definitely commits oneself, then Providence moves too. Whatever you think you can do, or
            believe you can do, begin it. Action has magic, power and grace.\" - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

step_of_the_day.title:
If it’s December 31, 2021 and you look back on the year, what action, goals, achievement would you be most
            happy about? Further cultivation of your aspirations and goals for 2021 (Pillar #9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Healthy growth and change is a cultivation process. It requires careful nurturing and it also requires –
            just as with the cultivation and growing of a plant – regular pruning and pulling of “weeds\" that can
            strangle growth of the plant. We can summarize this with the phrase “Right Thinking\". Most importantly for
            our consideration is the awareness that you don’t see a tomato, or a cucumber in the seeds you plant. But
            you know from experience that the seed will lead to a tomato or cucumber.There are two important pieces here:Growth can be occurring even when you don’t see the evidence. And growth is a slow gradual process that
            requires regular attention and “Right Thinking\". As well as patience and acceptance.But unlike a plant, which will yield a cucumber or tomato whether you believe and know this will happen or
            not – your belief is intimately involved in your personal growth and achievement.Two days ago, I asked you for the “Establishment:\" a plan, a mapping and finding The Path by visualizing
            some of the things you want for this year. To begin with, it’s not necessary to know the details of your
            plan or goals. Today, simply dream and visualize.

action_step:
Today let’s make these dreams more concrete: Identify specific goals for 2021 that are most important for
            you to achieve. Pick goals that are possible – even if you are unsure if you believe you can achieve them –
            for now. If you are keeping a journal, create a separate place in it for this process. Write about your
            goals as detailed as possible.
journal_entry: In addition to the action step, identify any feelings that come up as you go through this process.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Acknowledge your effort to identify your goals for this New Year. See you on The
            Path.
quote: "There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure." Colin Powell

step_of_the_day.title: The more you can visualize your goal, the more likely it will be realized (Pillar #9)
step_of_the_day.content:
If we stay with the metaphor of planting a seed, then combining the description of your goal with a
            visualization of its achievement is like putting a seed in nutrient-rich dirt and watering it. Visualization
            is like a combination of dress rehearsal and the experience of already achieving success. It contributes to
            another seminal ingredient to reach your goal: a felt sense of already having achieved the goal and
            therefore, enhancing your belief in its possibility.

action_step:
Create a description of your important goalMake the description as detailed as possibleVisualize – imagine or picture in your head – the achievement of this goal in as much detail as
            possibleAs you do this, notice how it feels. This is getting the “felt-sense\" of the achievement.
journal_entry: Write about your process of visualizing.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: your efforts to visualize and get a “felt-sense\" of your goals. Stay on The Path.
quote: “Courage is the commitment to begin without any guarantee of success\" Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

step_of_the_day.title:
Deciding that your goal is possible. Unlike growing a plant, believing that your goal is possible is
            important (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
There are some messages that are worth repeating – perhaps multiple times. They are that important to the
            achievement of your goals. Today that message to repeat is that it’s important for you to believe that your
            goal is possible. Notice I’m not saying that it will definitely happen. Just that it’s possible.Most of the time we get stuck because we focus – either consciously or unconsciously – on the possibilities
            of failure. We focus on how we think it won’t happen; how it’s very difficult and perhaps not likely to
            happen. This takes us down the path of failure, the path of negativity and the path of constraint and
            obstacles. Once you start down this path, you are going in the wrong direction.

action_step:
As you review one of the goals you are establishing for 2021, the one you have been visualizing, I want you
            to think about how it CAN happen! I want you to focus on the possibility that it can happen. Again, not that
            it’s guaranteed to happen, but how it can happen. This means:You will be able to connect with and speak with people important in the achievement of this goalYou will be able to procure materials needed to achieve this goalYou will be able to schedule sufficient time to fulfil the tasks you will need to doYou will gather sufficient funds needed to move forward with reaching this goalIn other words, with each of the steps leading to your goal, you can see the possibility of each step
            happening. Each of the steps, therefore, is possible.Complete your action step by saying, “Each step along the way of achieving my goal is possible for me to
            achieve!\" if I work hard enough, and stay focused enough, I will achieve my goal, which I have already
            determined is possible.
journal_entry: Write about your relationship with positive expectations.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Give yourself credit for focusing on what’s possible. This puts you on The Path.

step_of_the_day.title:
Summarizing your process of the last week and moving forward. Continuing to plant the seeds for a successful
            2021 (Pillars #1-9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Effective and successful living can be boiled down to two things: 1) the quality of your “presence\", and
            2) your strategy/plan for how you live your life, or your life intentions – the direction you want your life
            to take, and where you want to get to. The beginning of each year is a good time to set your intentions – at
            least for the year.This first week of January, I have been focusing on your 2021 goals. Each step this week supports that
            process. Therefore, I wanted to include all the steps for this week in today’s “step.\" Here are the “Steps\" over this past week:300: Start off this week with a declaration of your beliefs in yourself. As you do this remember two things:
            1) The declaration itself, engages a process in your brain that supports its reality and 2) the more you
            declare, the more strength the belief develops. 301: Identify one of the negative messages you give yourself. Make the decision that treating yourself this
            way is harmful and must stop. Then, shift into the voice of your healthy internal parent and speak from this
            place of love, acceptance, compassion and support. Decide to make these messages your new way of treating
            yourself. Create an affirmation to support this effort. 302: Let’s begin the establishment of a plan, a mapping and finding The Path by visualizing some of the
            things you want for this year. To begin with, it’s not necessary to know the details of your plan or goals.
            Today, simply dream and visualize. 303: Here are the 9 pillars of Resilience and Success:Relationship with selfRelationship with othersRelationship with something greaterPhysical balance and masteryMental balance and masteryEmotional balance and masteryPresenceFlexibilityPower – the ability to get things doneFor detailed descriptions of each of these pillars you can go to my website: www.DrStephenSideroff.comToday’s step is to make a commitment for growth in each of these areas. For example:I’m committing to be more loving and accepting of myself.I’m committing to set better boundaries with the people in my life; or I’m committing to be a better friend,
            husband, wife, etc.I’m committing to better define my purpose.I’m committing to practice a regular relaxation exercise to better manage my tension and stress.I’m committing to have a more positive attitude and to find what’s positive in life.I’m committing to not ignore my feelings and to resolve unfinished emotional business.I’m committing to be more present in my life and less on automatic.I’m committing to ways of being more flexible, such as seeing things from the perspective of others.I’m committing to follow through with my commitments, so I develop greater trust in myself.This may not cover some of your most important career or financial goals. We will go through them tomorrow.
            Today’s commitments have to do with your foundation for success and better health. 304: Today let’s make these dreams more concrete: Identify specific goals for 2021 that are most important
            for you to achieve. Pick goals that are possible – even if you are unsure if you believe you can achieve
            them – for now. If you are keeping a journal, create a separate place in it for this process. Write about
            your goals as detailed as possible. 305:Create a description of your important goal.Make the description as detailed as possible.Visualize – imagine or picture in your head – the achievement of this goal in as much detail as
            possible.As you do this, notice how it feels. This is getting the “felt-sense\" of the achievement. 306: As you review one of the goals you are establishing for 2021, the one you have been visualizing, I
            want you to think about how it CAN happen! I want you to focus on the possibility that it can happen. Again,
            not that it’s guaranteed to happen, but how it can happen. This means:You will be able to connect with and speak with people important in the achievement of this goal.You will be able to procure materials needed to achieve this goal.You will be able to schedule sufficient time to fulfil the tasks you will need to do.You will gather sufficient funds needed to move forward with reaching this goal.In other words, with each of the steps leading to your goal, you can see the possibility of each step
            happening. Each of the steps, therefore, is possible.Complete your action step by saying, “Each step along the way of achieving my goal is possible for me to
            achieve!\" if I work hard enough, and stay focused enough, I will achieve my goal, which I have already
            determined is possible.

action_step:
Today I’d like you to add fertilizer to the seeds for this year’s “crop\" (or goals). The first type of
            fertilizer is an accounting of some of your successes of the past. These successes demonstrate your
            capability. These successes demonstrate some of your qualities and abilities and “smarts\" that can now be
            focused on this year’s achievements.What successes are you proud of? What did the achievement of these successes demonstrate about yourself; in
            terms of courage, decision making, planning, awareness, focus or other qualities?
journal_entry: Write about your successes and how they can serve as a foundation for your next “steps.\"

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you took time yesterday to fertilize your dreams and goals by owning and
            elaborating on your achievements, this was another step you have taken on The Path.
quote: “Courage is the commitment to begin without any guarantee of success\" Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

step_of_the_day.title: Staying focused on what you want to achieve. Keeping your eye on “the prize\" (Pillar #5, 7, 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
If you are doing what today’s step says – staying focused - you will have noticed that I’m using the same
            quote from Mr. Goethe, as yesterday. Courage focuses you on taking the next step – not looking for
            guarantees and not dwelling on what can go wrong or what might not happen. I’m highlighting this quote to
            indicate how important it is in you achieving success.Courage is making the decision to do whatever it takes to reach your goal. Courage is not allowing
            nervousness, fear, or discomfort to stop you from taking the actions you must take. Furthermore, it’s this
            display of courage – taking the challenge – that instigates the greatest growth in you. And it’s this growth
            and self-trust, that then supports the achievement of your goals. Can you see the positive snowball effect?

action_step:
Take a difficult action today that will move you closer to your goals. Reach inside to make the decision to
            take this action even if there is uncertainty. Make the decision to take this action even if there is no
            guarantee of success. Find the courage to take this action because you want to take the challenge that fuels
            your greatest growth and success.
journal_entry: When you take this step, it’s very important to appreciate your courage! Write about your courage.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you followed through with something difficult yesterday, that’s great. That put
            you on The Path.
quote:
“When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.\" Viktor E.
            Frankl, “Man’s search for meaning\"

step_of_the_day.title: Take some time to “recalculate.\" Today give yourself the opportunity to become more balanced (Pillar #4)
step_of_the_day.content:
One of my clients reminded me yesterday, that not everyone is able – while in lock-down – to follow their
            dreams or pursue their goals. It reminded me of the lessons from Psychiatrist Viktor Frankl, who was
            interned by the Nazis in their concentration camps during World War II. Dr. Frankl wrote the book, “Man’s
            search for meaning\" and shared some of the lessons of that experience as well as what helped him survive
            that harrowing period. One of his key statements in that book is: “Everything can be taken from a man but
            one thing: the last of the human freedoms – to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to
            choose one’s own way.\"During this very restrictive and dangerous period, I have suggested that there is always a “best way\" to
            handle your circumstances. By focusing on finding this best way, you are taking your life into your own
            hands. This sense of control is a key ingredient to being resilient. As Frankl notes, choosing your attitude
            during this pandemic is important, and setting goals for yourself is part of that process. If the goals you
            want are currently out of reach, as my 8th pillar of resilience suggests, be flexible and identify goals
            that are more achievable.

action_step:
One goal, in and of itself, is to develop greater resilience. Today, take steps in this direction byLetting go of some things you don’t have control over, andTake time to engage in a relaxation and visualization exercise – to achieve greater physical balance and
            control.
journal_entry: Write about how you are coming along in developing greater resilience.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you took the time to let go and to practice your relaxation/visualization
            exercise, that put you on The Path.
quote:
“I do not forget any good deed done to me and I do not carry a grudge for a bad one.\" - Viktor E.
            Frankl

step_of_the_day.title: Letting go of a grudge. Find where you carry resentment, and get resolution within yourself (Pillar #6)
step_of_the_day.content:
When you carry a grudge, the only person affected by it is you. It creates tension in your body. It
            activates your nervous system unnecessarily. And it takes control of aspects of your life because it makes
            you reactive. Letting go of a grudge is not doing a favor for someone else, it releases you from bondage.

action_step:
Identify a grudge that you have been carrying – even if that grudge is against yourself. Recognize that it’s
            only hurting and getting in your way. If the thought of this results in feelings coming up, let that be OK
            and express the feelings. Then make the decision to let go.
journal_entry: Write about any difficulty you have letting go of negative feelings such as anger, resentment and regret.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Take a moment to appreciate any effort you made to let go of resentment. Be on The
            Path.
quote:
“We are all in it together\" - many famous and not famous people“ 
 If you are not contributing to the solution, you are part of the problem\" - many more people

step_of_the_day.title:
Contributing to the solution. Identify what you can do to contribute positive energy – Positive Karma – to
            your community, your world (Pillar #3)
step_of_the_day.content:
There are so many big issues happening in the world that touch all our lives. There is the current
            impeachment, the attack on our capital, black Lives Matter and social injustice, the Coronavirus pandemic
            and the economic repercussions. It’s important to allow yourself to be touched and feel these experiences
            long enough to be moved to take some sort of action. At the same time, it’s easy to ignore any
            responsibility and thus stay passive.

action_step:
Take some action today to contribute to the solution. If you are blessed by not having the virus; if you are
            able to avoid situations in which you might become infected; if you have been fortunate to not be affected
            by the economic hardships the pandemic has engendered, find a way of giving back. Find a way of being part
            of the solution – today.
journal_entry: What do you feel is your responsibility to community?

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: If you took time and energy to “give back\" that put you on The Path.
quote: “Good habits are the basis of good health\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title: The Path of a Resilient Routine. Establishing a regular routine for greater resilience (Pillars #1 & 4)
step_of_the_day.content:
This could have been the first “step\" of this program. I’m referring to the creation of your own
            “Resilience Routine\"; ongoing habits that are good for you, your health and longevity. The establishment of
            regular routines will help you stay consistent in your personal development.A resilience routine would be actions you take on a regular basis, to develop along the dimensions of
            resilience. Today we will consider two components of a Resilient Routine. Once these have been firmly
            installed in your day, we will add additional components to your routine.

action_step:
Today establish two parts of a Resilient Routine:Create an affirmation that focuses on strengthening a loving relationship with yourself. For example, “I
            treat myself well, accept myself and deserve good things in my life\"Establish a regular relaxation exercise that you do every day. The goal is for this to be about 15 minutes
            (you can download an audio track from my website). Make sure, even if you are pressed for time, that you do
            this every day. If you can’t do the entire 15 minutes, do at least 5 minutes.
journal_entry: Write about your previous efforts to establish a healthy routine.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you initiate or continue with the two hallmarks of a Resilient Routine? That put
            you on The Path
quote:
“Being open to new approaches and behaviors will lead to greater success and health\" Stephen
            Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title: Becoming flexible with your boundaries. Taking a step in getting unstuck (Pillar #8)
step_of_the_day.content:
You have probably heard the expression, doing the same thing and expecting different results is the
            definition of insanity. Yet, in many ways this is how we lead our lives. I conceptualize this as the
            unspoken and unconscious boundaries we establish around ourselves. What is inside the boundary identifies
            what we are ok with and what’s outside the boundary includes everything we believe is wrong, or difficult,
            or dangerous. The boundary identifies our beliefs and our rules – what we allow of our behavior and
            thinking.These boundaries, learned as part of our childhood lessons, are not necessarily good and they only serve to
            limit us. Resilience is about the ability to continually adapt to new situations in life. Our boundaries
            limit this ability to adapt.

action_step:
Identify some of your beliefs and thinking (your boundaries) that might be limiting you and interfere with
            achieving your goals.
journal_entry:
Write about your resistance or fears about moving outside your existing boundaries. Write about any
            stubbornness you notice in yourself.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Are you paying attention to your where you are going? Find The Path.
quote:
“To the world you might be one person, but to one person, you might be the world. Kindness is the golden
            chain by which our world is bound together\" Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

step_of_the_day.title:
Put energy into how you treat the other people in your life. How can you contribute to the well-being of
            others in your life? (Pillar #2)
step_of_the_day.content:
It’s easy to get so absorbed in your own life, in your own struggle, in your own stresses that you miss
            what’s going on around you. When this happens, it feels like you don’t have any spare energy or time for
            others. Frequently when I’m working with a couple, particularly during difficult times, the anger and
            resentment is about what each is not getting from the other. These are patterns based in scarcity; a feeling
            that there isn’t enough to go around.When the focus shifts to helping others, to giving support and care and sending love and energy out,
            miracles seem to happen. The two miracles that I always notice are 1) there is a feeling of relief and
            satisfaction, and 2) I come in contact with a sense of abundance – that there is more available than before.
            And this abundance might be emotional abundance or material abundance.

action_step:
Find an opportunity today to support, love and give to someone in your life. When you do, notice if you find
            those two miracles.
journal_entry: Write about your perspective and determine if it’s one of scarcity or abundance.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Did you take time to be supportive of someone yesterday? That put you on The Path

step_of_the_day.title:
Being present to notice your “choice points.\" Choice points occur in almost every moment of your life.
            Awaken to these moments for greater resilience and success (Pillar #7)
step_of_the_day.quote:
“Being on The Path is about being present in order to notice, and make, the right choices\" Stephen
            Sideroff
step_of_the_day.content:
You are faced with choices throughout your day and your life. The choices you make determine your happiness
            and success. But most of the time we blow right past choice points as we follow our old pattern. A choice
            point might be when you shy away from a challenge because it’s uncomfortable, perceived as being too
            difficult or perhaps you imagine it won’t turn out the way you want. If you awaken to this moment, you might
            instead decide, “let me make a different choice, by adopting a new perspective, in which I imagine that it
            will turn out well, or that I can be more accepting of my actions.Choice points are those moments in which you can decide to think, feel and frame a situation in a more
            positive, constructive and supportive manner. This new decision will change your life.

action_step:
During this next day, make an effort to notice choice points, moments in which you can choose a more
            supportive, accepting and positive perspective and approach. By doing so, see if this makes it possible to
            take a challenge and engage in more successful behaviors.
journal_entry:
Write about one of your stuck points and what it is about your automatic pattern, perspective or fears that
            get in your way. How can you do this differently?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: How present were you yesterday to notice your mental “choice points\"? Were you able
            to choose The Path in those moments?

step_of_the_day.title:
“Every moment is of infinite value\" Make this true today. Each moment you are present and fully value the
            moment, you are magnifying, leveraging, and expanding your growth (Pillars #1, 7, & 9)
step_of_the_day.quote:
“Be always resolute with the present hour. Every moment is of infinite value\" Johann Wolfgang von
            Goethe
step_of_the_day.content:
Being present is like a bank giving your account an interest payment. And the more moments you are present,
            the more this interest gets compounded. When a bank compounds your interest, that interest begins earning
            interest on itself. In other words, the interest that’s added to your account starts working for you to earn
            even more money. Interest on top of interest: interest compounded.Each moment that you are present and – as Mr. von Goethe says – you treat the moment as having “infinite
            value\", the lessons you are available for in that moment immediately begin to work for you to enhance the
            next and future moments of your life. Like compounded interest in a bank account, this is “compounded and
            enhanced living, learning and growth\".

action_step:
Take today’s quote to heart: “Every moment is of infinite value\". When you find yourself present, notice
            the value of that moment. Allow this awareness to inspire your personal growth.
journal_entry: What growth have you been noticing as you have been following the last 315 steps?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: How many moments of “infinite value\" did you create and experience yesterday? The
            potential was and still is, for it to be: every moment that you are present. Stay on The Path.

step_of_the_day.title:
Pay attention to what you carry in your heart today. Look at what you are carrying in your heart and how
            this influences what you see and experience in the world (Pillar #6)
step_of_the_day.quote: “A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart\" Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
step_of_the_day.content:
Everything you see in the world is, to some degree, a reflection of what is inside you. If you are angry,
            you will see reasons to be angry. If you are happy, you will see reasons to be happy. The result is how your
            perspective and your attitude determine the kind of day and life you have.

action_step:
You can start by paying attention to what you carry in your heart and how this gets projected out into the
            world. But then decide to carry love and caring in your heart. Then notice how this is reflected in the
            world around you. Notice how your day and your life feel better when you come from this place.
journal_entry: Reflect on what you typically “carry in your heart.\"

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: In the last few days have you focused on coming from your heart? See you on The
            Path.
quote: “Good habits get easier to perform the more you do them\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Establishing a regular routine for greater resilience (Pillars #1 & 4) (Repeat of Step 312 with
            additions)
step_of_the_day.content:
One of the steps last week was the establishment of a “Resilient Routine,\" a process that you do daily. It
            is the creation of positive habits that over time become automatic, ensuring healthy behaviors; behaviors
            that support your optimal functioning. I encouraged you to establish two parts of a Resilient routine:Create an affirmation that focuses on strengthening a loving relationship with yourself. For example, “I
            treat myself well, accept myself and deserve good things in my life.\"Establish a regular relaxation exercise that you do every day. The goal is for this to be about 15 minutes
            (you can download an audio track from my website). Make sure, even if you are pressed for time, that you do
            this every day. If you can’t do the entire 15 minutes, do at least 5 minutes.How well have you followed through with these two daily steps? However well you did, can you acknowledge
            that they are important to your optimal health and performance? If I assume you said “Yes\" to this
            question, then you would be interested and motivated to improve upon your performance. So, today’s step is
            to follow through with those steps, presented above while adding the steps below.

action_step:
Create a second affirmation that focuses on your performance and following through. Again, remember,
            affirmations are “As if\" statements written as if you have already achieved them. An example might be, “I
            take action and get things done in a timely manner.\" Or, “I don’t let my fear or worries get in my
            way.\"Each time you sit down for a meal, take 30 seconds to go into a place of gratitude for the meal and what’s
            good in your life and who are the people who are good in your life.
journal_entry: Write about your efforts and resistance to establish a healthy routine.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: The steps of a Resilient Routine I gave you have been simple yet important in the
            development of greater resilience and success. Have you followed through? If you have, you are giving
            yourself important gifts – congratulations! If you have not, what’s your resistance? Find The Path.
quote: "The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity." Amelia Earhart

step_of_the_day.title:
Examining your resistance to loving yourself and being on The Path. The biggest step forward sometimes is
            removing your own resistance to doing the right thing (Pillar #1)
step_of_the_day.content:
Everyone experiences some resistance. This is what’s behind procrastination. It’s also behind not getting
            your needs met. The resistance isn’t intentional. It develops out of fears, discomfort, uncertainty and
            emotional wounding. Where does your resistance originate from? For some of us it’s not believing the goal is
            possible. For some, the effort might appear too great. Or the unconscious belief, “I’ll put in all this
            energy and it won’t make a difference.\" It might be the feeling of not deserving and thus there is
            self-sabotage.Frequently resistance comes from that negative voice that focuses on the judgments of others or not getting
            it right – making a mistake. Perhaps you say you want something, but you are not motivated enough to make
            the effort. It can be that you haven’t truly made the decision.

action_step:
If you have not been following through with the “steps\" of this program, take a moment to identify what
            your resistance is about. How can you shift this to support a better follow through? If you have been taking
            the steps, where else in your life can you identify resistance that’s getting in your way of success? I will
            address breaking through resistance in upcoming steps.
journal_entry: Write about your resistance to taking actions in your life.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: What have you identified as your resistance – to moving forward, to doing a
            difficult task, to following through with The Steps, to doing anything that you say you want to do? Being
            able to identify and describe your resistance – which we all have – is the first step in overcoming it and
            must be recognized. If you are not aware of, or acknowledge your resistance, it will interfere with your
            success. Join me on The Path.
quote: “Unacknowledged resistance will defeat any plan\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Acknowledging your resistance and getting at its source. Noticing your negative self-judgments as a source
            of your resistance (Pillars #1 & 5)
step_of_the_day.content:
Everyone copes with their resistance. It’s a normal aspect to how you approach the challenges of life.
            Resistance is fueled by your doubts: about yourself, about others and about the forces of the universe. It’s
            that simple. It’s fueled by your judgments: about yourself, about others and about the judgments you project
            onto other people (what you imagine THEY judge you about). Even though these judgments may be experienced as
            protecting you (stopping you from getting into danger) they most often simply create a drag, or resistance
            to you doing what’s difficult but necessary for progress and your success.This resistance is part of – the voice of - your Primitive Gestalt Pattern. It’s judgments and negative
            expectations translate into resistance.

action_step:
Identify the messages your old internal parent gives you that create resistance to taking action or to
            believing in yourself.
journal_entry: Write about how your internal voice creates your resistance.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Have you been noticing your resistance and your negative self-judgments? This
            awareness is a step on The Path. They point out what you need to let go of.
quote: “Keeping your word is the first step toward success\" Stephen Sideroff and many others.

step_of_the_day.title:
Are you keeping your word in life and with others? Pay attention to what you say you will do, and what you
            commit to, and then follow through (Pillars #1, 5, & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
There are some basic principles for living in resilience and success. Today’s step may be at the top of this
            list. Say what you are going to do – setting goals – and then doing what you say you will do. Following
            through. When you do this, you engender trust and belief in yourself. This is at the heart of
            self-confidence.

action_step:
Set an intention to take an important action today. Be very specific with the action to be taken. And then
            make sure you keep your word!
journal_entry: Write about how you have been keeping your word and showing up.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you keep your word yesterday? Did you set an intention and then follow through
            with that action? That put you on The Path of Resilience and Success!
quote: “Courage is the commitment to begin without any guarantee of success\" Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

step_of_the_day.title:
Redefining success in order to take action.Not letting fear of judgment or failure get in your way
              of taking action (Pillars #6 & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
What gets in your way of taking action? Is it fear of failure? Fear of making a mistake? Fear of being
            judged – by others or yourself? Fear of not knowing enough? Fear of not being enough? What’s most important
            to move you forward in life is to take action – even in the face of these sources of resistance. What’s most
            important is to find your courage to act even when there is uncertainty. What’s most important is to learn
            that The Path for your progress in life and toward your goals and a growing trust in yourself is taking
            these difficult steps and being on The Path.

action_step:
Commit to an important action today and follow through. Keep your word. Take a risk. Do what’s difficult.
            Ignore the obstacles.
journal_entry: Write about your journey of growth and self-confidence.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you take action? If you did, that itself was success, no matter the outcome.
            Stay on The Path.
quote:
“Life is about noticing your needs and taking appropriate action to get those needs met\" Stephen Sideroff
            and others

step_of_the_day.title:
Take some step today to take care of yourself. Identify what you are needing – and take action to get that
            need met (Pillar #1)
step_of_the_day.content:
Optimal functioning and a basic goal of life is staying in balance and returning to balance when you notice
            you are out of balance. In other words, it’s about recognizing your needs and interacting with the
            environment to get those needs met. This happens when you notice you’re hungry and get something to eat. And
            even when you realize you need a hug. Your needs are physical, emotional, as well as social and
            spiritual.If your needs weren’t met as a child, you may have learned to ignore your needs. This may even make it
            difficult to recognize the needs you have that haven’t been met. When this is true, it’s easy to substitute
            – for example substituting making more money instead of getting emotional needs met.

action_step:
Identify an emotional need you have, such as the need for love, attention, appreciation. Take some action
            today to get that need met. If you are alone, reach out to someone. If there is no one to reach out to, give
            yourself some loving.
journal_entry: Write about how well you take care of your needs.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: How well did you take care of yourself yesterday? Stay on The Path.
quote: “The key to success is doing the common things uncommonly well\" John D. Rockefeller, Jr.

step_of_the_day.title: Pay attention to how focused you are while going through your day (Pillar #7 & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
One of the dichotomies I’ve been discussing is between functioning automatically (as we usually do), versus
            being present each moment - supporting living in a place of choice. To grow and keep improving you must be
            able to make the choice to do or think differently from what you were taught, moment by moment.In addition to choosing how you want to be and respond; the next step is to hold the intention to do it
            uncommonly well. To keep shooting for excellence in how you are in the world.

action_step:
Today hold the intention to be as present as much of the time as possible, allowing for you to be in a place
            of choice. From that place, be exceptional in your performance.
journal_entry: How important is it for you to always give 100%?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Were you excellent in performing your actions/tasks yesterday. Every day you have
            the opportunity to be on The Path.
quote: "The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today." Franklin D. Roosevelt

step_of_the_day.title:
Refocusing on your moment by moment choices. Each moment you can go – mentally – in either the old direction
            or the new. Notice the choice points in your day and choose the new and positive direction. (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
Your common mental/emotional pattern, learned over all the years of your life, can take you in the wrong
            direction. Every time you say something is difficult, or I don’t know if I can do it, you head down the
            wrong path; starting off by handicapping yourself. Every time you worry about what someone else with think,
            or judge you, you are also starting down that crippling path. If you worry that you won’t be able to do it
            on time, do it well enough – right! – you are also heading down that same path.The healthy, resilient and successful approach of thinking emanates from the healthy internal parent we have
            been working on developing. Remember, that’s from a place of Love, Compassion, Acceptance, Support and Care.
            It focuses on the possibilities, not the difficulties; the reasons why you can do it, not what will get in
            the way.

action_step:
Today, notice your choice points: those moments when you can choose thoughts that are more supportive of
            your success and your goals and happiness. In those moments choose to listen to your healthy internal
            parent.
journal_entry: How have you been doing in calling upon your healthy internal parent?

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Did you notice your opportunities to make new choices? That put you on The Path.
quote: "Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm." Winston Churchill

step_of_the_day.title:
Shifting away from a mistake, a loss, or other emotional pain. Become committed to letting go of emotional
            baggage (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
Negative things happen – as we have been experiencing over this past year. Loss and other emotional
            experiences are part of life. In fact, when you are breaking new ground, reaching for your goals, trying
            something new, mistakes are likely and part of the territory.The goal is not trying to live life free of these painful experiences – that will only create constriction,
            anxiety and worry. The goal is to accept that these experiences occur. And when they occur you handle them
            in the most constructive way. Optimal functioning, resilient functioning occurs when you are able to let go
            of negative energy. Here are the steps:Feel and accept your reaction to an upset. Whatever emotions are triggered by an event/experience be
            accepting of them; feel the feelings.Allow for the expression of these feelings. Remember, feelings are not right or wrong. If they are there,
            they need to be experienced in order for them to move through your body and be released.Once you accept, feel and express what you are feeling, it’s then your responsibility to let them go.If the experience is a mistake, then identify the lesson to be learned so that it doesn’t happen again.

action_step:
Identify an upset or feeling that you are carrying around like excess baggage. Go through the four steps
            above to let go and move on.
journal_entry: Write about your experiences in letting go of feelings and other negative experiences.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Take a moment to own your follow through with yesterday’s step -to let go of any
            piece of unfinished business. This reduces unconscious distractions and puts you on The Path.
quote: “Living with no regrets happens when you are living in the moment and making the most of every moment\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Taking a step to be present and in a place of balance. Today, find opportunities to check in with your
            physical, emotional, and mental state. Wherever you are out of balance, find a way to restore balance based
            on the lessons of The Path.
step_of_the_day.content:
Today’s step is about holding two intensions: 1) to be present in as many moments of the day as possible,
            and 2) when you are present to identify any imbalance and take steps to move back into balance.As I’ve noted, living with intention and choice only happens when you step out of habitual behavior and step
            into presence in the moment. Therefore, the more moments you do this, the more effective you will be and the
            more you will accomplish – or the more you will go into a place of healthy balance.People in my programs from executives to athletes to others wanting to achieve optimal or peak performance
            have learned how easily stresses and worries can distract from the moment. When this happens, we revert to
            our old and inefficient patterns. It also makes it more difficult to notice physical, emotional, and mental
            imbalance – be it a. physical: tension in our necks, belly or elevated heart rate, b. emotional: carrying
            resentment or other upset, and c. focusing on what can go wrong, what isn’t right and other negative
            thoughts.

action_step:
Find ways of bringing yourself into the present moment – schedule moments in your calendar, set an alarm, or
            use other reminders such as post-its or using mealtime – and when you bring yourself present, notice any
            imbalance as described above.Follow this by engaging in some process to restore balance in your life. More detailed approaches in past
            steps as well as next few steps.
journal_entry: Write about what you notice that takes you out of balance.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you held the intention to be present yesterday and incorporated some way of
            reminding yourself – that’s success and it put you on The Path. If you then noticed some imbalance, that
            moved you along The Path. And if you found a way to restore balance – by going into 6 breaths per minute to
            enhance your autonomic self-regulation or be resolving some piece of emotional unfinished business – you are
            “in flow\" on The Path.
quote: "Life is ours to be spent, not to be saved." D. H. Lawrence

step_of_the_day.title: Connect with and strengthen one of your relationships. Reach out to a person you care about (Pillar #2)
step_of_the_day.content:
During the current isolation, with its limitations on contact, it’s easy to lose touch with people. Your
            relationships are important and create opportunities for receiving and offering emotional nourishment and
            support. This, in turn, helps you cope with the challenges of the pandemic.

action_step:
Find time today to reach out to a person you have not been in touch with recently. Someone you care about.
            Let them know how important they are to you (allow yourself to be vulnerable by saying this). Send them some
            emotional nourishment and notice what you get back.
journal_entry: Write about how you get emotional support from the people in your life.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you made a connection with someone important to you that gave you emotional
            nourishment - this put you on The Path.
quote: “What you are not aware of will undermine you\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title: Take time today to “Stalk your pattern.\" Notice any negative messages you give yourself (Pillar #1 & 5)
step_of_the_day.content:
You are guided by the lessons of the past. The voice you hear 24/7 is the spokesperson of those lessons. But
            most of the time this occurs outside your awareness. You are already heading down a negative, worry-filled
            path so quickly that it feels automatic.

action_step:
Pay attention to your feelings today. Any time you have a negative feeling, such as anxiety, worry or
            depression, take it as a signal or cue, that unconsciously, you just said something to yourself that caused
            it. Perhaps it was “It’s not going to work out\", or “Something bad is going to happen\", or “You will be
            judged\". When you notice this, shift into the voice of your “Healthy internal parent\" coming from a place
            of love, compassion, acceptance, support and care. Then notice how this shifts your feelings.
journal_entry: Write about the pattern you are identifying.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: What did you discover when you stalked your pattern? Find The Path.
quote: “When you take full responsibility for your life, your dreams come true\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Do a “Thought experiment\" today: Imagine being responsible for everything that happens in your life. Be the
            “owner\" of your life. (Pillar #6 & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Sometimes it’s helpful to adopt a mental and emotional strategy for life that – while it might not make
            sense to you – will result in great success. One of these ways is referred to as “Radical responsibility\".
            This is where you take responsibility for everything that happens in your life. When you do this, one
            consequence is you are not able to make excuses!

action_step: Today, take responsibility and full ownership of your life and the results you experience.
journal_entry: Notice the benefits you experience from adopting this approach

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you take full ownership of your life during the last two days? If you did, how
            did it feel and what results did you notice? See you on The Path
quote: “If you give your full commitment to today, you will be creating a successful life\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Give 100% in your actions and thinking today. Be fully committed to creating success for yourself today
            (Pillars #1, 5 & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
We don’t get any redo’s in life. By this I mean, you only have one shot at today! You can’t go back and redo
            it if you wasted it, procrastinated or spent your time on actions that are not that important.

action_step:
To make your day most effective and productive – and yield the life you want - live it with intention.
            Create an intention to make a difference in your own life. Decide what actions can do this for you and
            follow through and do them. Include positive thinking to support those actions.
journal_entry: Write about how well you follow through with your intentions.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you give 100% in your actions and thinking yesterday – with no excuses? That put
            you on The Path.
quote: “You don’t need a clear desk, but you need a clear mind\" - Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title: Take a step to clear your mind today. Identifying unfinished business and clearing it (Pillars #5 & 6)
step_of_the_day.content:
Which came first, the chicken or the egg? When I think of the mind body connection, the question is, “which
            came first the thinking or the emotion?\" Well, I can give you good arguments both ways. But today I want to
            share how unfinished emotional business interferes with thinking and being present.You have an instinct, a primal drive to get resolution. And high on the list of what needs to be resolved
            are feelings. Any feeling not addressed and resolved results in a part of your energy unconsciously trying
            to finish that unfinished business. In other words, part of your energy is distracted from the present
            moment – lost in space. And the more unfinished business, the greater the loss of focus. As this is a
            habitual pattern the underlying emotional unfinished business is frequently hidden from awareness. In fact,
            it can be a source of loss of awareness as an effort to avoid. It also wastes energy.

action_step:
Identify a piece of your emotional unfinished business. This is some energy you are holding in one of your
            relationships; or it could be around a loss or mistake you made (thus unfinished emotional business with
            yourself). It might be helpful to sit calmly, putting everything aside, and noticing what comes into your
            awareness. Then declare the intention to let go of this burden (being angry at someone is mostly affecting
            you, as your body must literally “hold in\" the energy. This also contributes to tiredness). Allow yourself
            to feel and express the emotion – having it move through your body. And then make the decision to let go.
journal_entry:
Write about your difficulty letting go of emotional unfinished business, or your tendency to hold a grudge
            or hurt.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you address a piece of your excess baggage? Your unfinished business? This
            reduces “drag\" in your life and puts you on The Path.
quote: “What you resist persists\" Anonymous

step_of_the_day.title: Make this a “NO PROCRASTINATION\" day. Complete a task you have been procrastinating doing (Pillar #9)
step_of_the_day.content:
At the simplest of levels when you procrastinate you get in the way of your progress. But procrastination is
            also about not keeping your word! You say you are going to do something – or say you want to do something –
            and then don’t follow through. This sends an unconscious message to yourself. That message is, “I don’t keep
            my word\", “I can’t count on myself\", “I don’t follow through\" “I give up too easily\" or “I experience
            actions I need to take as being too difficult for me\". This undermines trust in yourself and ultimately
            impacts self-confidence.To be most effective in life, it’s important to keep your word – especially to yourself! If there is
            something that needs to be done, you “Just do it\" as the Nike saying goes.

action_step:
Today identify some behavior you have procrastinated around – and Just Do It! To support yourself in this
            process, you might find breaking the task into smaller pieces helps you take action. But – do whatever it
            takes to take a step in the direction of completion.
journal_entry: What’s your relationship with procrastination?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Give yourself credit for following through with a task you had been procrastinating
            about. This put you on The Path. If you didn’t follow through, you can drop this item from your “To do\"
            list, as not being important enough, or determine what your resistance or fear is about. If the item is
            important, this resistance needs to be addressed.
quote: “I failed my way to success.\" Thomas Edison

step_of_the_day.title:
Make today a day of “self-acceptance.\" As you go through your day today, any time you notice either a
            self-judgment or imagining a judgment from someone else, shift into a place of accepting yourself.
step_of_the_day.content:
Negative judgments will undermine your goals, your actions, your productivity, your success and your
            happiness. You judge or imagine the judgments of others because you somehow learned this through lessons of
            childhood and because you unconsciously believe it serves you. In fact, it hurts you more than it protects
            you.

action_step:
Do an experiment today of self-acceptance. Every time you notice you are being hampered by a judgment of
            yourself – switch and come from a place of acceptance. Every time you imagine that someone else is judging
            you – or that someone will judge you if you take an action – again shift into a place of acceptance. Notice
            how this makes a difference.
journal_entry: Write about how judgments get in your way.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you engaged in yesterday’s experiment of shifting from judgment to acceptance,
            notice how more effective and enjoyable your day was. Be on The Path.
quote:
“Be always resolute with the present hour. Every moment is of infinite value.\" Johann Wolfgang von
            Goethe

step_of_the_day.title:
The importance of being present. Find multiple times today to bring yourself present – into the moment
            (Pillar #7)
step_of_the_day.content:
“Every moment is of infinite value.\" What if you lived your life based on this belief? What results will
            you get? If every moment is of infinite value, you might make a greater effort to get more out of every
            moment of your day and thus of your life.

action_step:
To support the intention of valuing each moment by being present, find ways to remind yourself, to awaken
            yourself to many moments of your day. Set your alarm for multiple times, establish mealtimes or identify
            something in your environment – such as doorways - as a cue to remind you to wake up.
journal_entry: Write about your commitment to being more present in your life and why you think this is important.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: How present were you yesterday? What difference did it make in your life? Stay on
            The Path.
quote: “Worthiness is not attached to results\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title: Find your value in who you are (Pillar #1)
step_of_the_day.content:
Stress, the treadmill, always feeling pressure, and anxiety all have a common root: not feeling worthy
            enough and trying to do and accomplish more in order to get the feeling of being OK. But you have probably
            noticed that while your successes bring a sense of relief – it’s only temporary.As long as you tie your worth to your accomplishments - your results - you will only achieve fleeting
            happiness. Deep satisfaction comes from liking who you are, accepting who you are, and deciding that this is
            what gives you value.

action_step:
To support the intention of valuing each moment by being present, find ways to remind yourself, to awaken
            yourself to many moments of your day. Set your alarm for multiple times, establish mealtimes or identify
            something in your environment – such as doorways - as a cue to remind you to wake up.
journal_entry: Write about your commitment to being more present in your life and why you think this is important.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: If you found value and thus worthiness in yourself, that put you on The Path.

step_of_the_day.title:
Live today from a place of excellence in your relationships. Reach inside to find and project excellence in
            your relationships (Pillar #2)
step_of_the_day.content:
“Everyone has the ability to source their lives from a place of excellence. But it needs to be chosen and
            committed to." This is another step in your ongoing process of shifting away from your Primitive Gestalt Pattern. That
            story or framework absorbed from your environment and upbringing. One way of shifting is to identify aspects
            of your old pattern as we have done in previous steps. Another way is to identify or model the framework or
            pattern that supports success in your life.The framework I suggest is one of excellence. Remember in school, when you were the best in the class, your
            grade was “Excellent\". This framework means that in everything you do you strive for excellence.

journal_entry: Write about whether you choose to live from a place of excellence. If not, what gets in your way?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you came from a place of excellence in your relationships yesterday, what did you
            notice about the quality of the connections? How did it feel? Stay on The Path – it results in happiness and
            success!
quote: “Treat your body like a temple: honor it, heal it and support it.\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Live today from a place of excellence in your physical balance and mastery. Set the intension of being in
            excellence physically (Pillar #4)
step_of_the_day.content:
I am taking you through the 9 pillars of The Path from a place of excellence: the ultimate approach to your
            life that leads to success, happiness, and health. As a side benefit, it will also result in slowing the
            aging process.Today I’m focusing on recovering from the stresses of life. These stresses cause the activation of your
            nervous system which depletes the resources of your body. It throws your body out of balance. Like a car
            that hasn’t been tuned up, with new spark plugs and filters. It is no longer efficient, gets poor gas
            mileage, only runs on 2-3 cylinders, spews more pollution and most importantly has greater difficulty
            driving up hills (read: your stresses and life challenges).The result is greater wear and tear on your body and the greater likelihood of an organ system breaking
            down. It’s the ultimate “Mind-Body Connection\".

action_step:
Today, to help your body recover and restore balance, take 15 minutes to practice a relaxation exercise (if
            you don’t have an audio relaxation exercise you can find a free download on my website:
            www.DrStephenSideroff.com).
journal_entry: Write about how you treat your body and your intensions to do this better.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Yesterday’s action step supports your recovery from stress and thus becoming
            resilient. If you took the step, you are on The Path. If you didn’t, you might not notice any difference,
            but your body will. It’s easy to get back onto The Path by doing the exercise today- even if it’s less than
            15 minutes – as well as to take today’s step. Sometimes, living with intension isn’t easy, but it does lead
            to success and resilience. It puts you on The Path.
quote: “If you live criticizing people, you won't have time to love them.\" Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

step_of_the_day.title:
Set the intension to be excellent mentally today. Eliminate judgments from your day – of others AND of
            yourself (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
There are many aspects to optimal thinking that can support your resilience and success. A big one is the
            elimination of judgments. When I mention this in my workshops I always hear, “But aren’t judgments a part of
            life?\" or “My judgments help me get ahead\". I’d like to make a distinction between discernment, or a
            healthy evaluation of a situation versus negative judgments that hurt or undermine your self-confidence and
            ability to take action.Negative judgments send a message of not being OK, of not being good enough. Negative judgments of others
            can be referred to as criticism. Again, we can distinguish this from healthy and supportive feedback.

action_step:
Today, hold yourself to excellent thinking by not criticizing or judging yourself or others negatively. If
            you notice you are doing so, interrupt yourself and shift into a more supportive and caring statement;
            again, with yourself and with others. Remember, if you continually criticize yourself, there leaves no room
            for loving yourself.
journal_entry:
Write about any tendency of yours to criticize or make negative judgments. What benefit do you derive from
            this behavior?

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Every time you shifted from judgment to acceptance you moved along The Path.
quote: “Right thinking will always take you in the right direction on The Path\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title: Learning “Right thinking\" (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
