“Right thinking\" points you in the direction of a successful life. A life of optimal health,
            relationships, and performance. Right thinking supports living a life of excellence. You remember in school
            when you took an exam or got your grades at the end of a year, the best students received grades of “A\" or
            Excellent. They were typically the students earmarked for great things in life. You can be that student. You
            can live every day at the level of excellence. And source your results from this grounding.Excellence in your thinking refers to focusing on possibilities rather than difficulties, what can go right
            rather than what can go wrong. Part of this process requires identifying unproductive or destructive habits
            and working to eliminate them. One example is a tendency to get distracted easily when doing an important
            task. If it’s experienced as difficult, uncomfortable or with the concern of not being able to do it well,
            there might be a tendency to shrink from it by shifting to something easy: an easier task, playing
            solitaire, or simply checking out. Thus, right thinking is first recognizing the undermining negative
            thinking, putting a fire wall between you and it, and then shifting into right thinking which would look
            like, “If I fully go for it I can do it – or I see the possibilities. I’m allowed to not be perfect and to
            make a mistake. I will appreciate my efforts and be accepting of myself.\"Another example would be living with the expectation that something will go wrong, that the world is
            dangerous, or someone will do you wrong. This “wrong thinking\" will automatically cause you to shrink from
            the contact boundary between you and your environment. When this happens, it renders you less present, less
            available, and less “response-able\". Right thinking focuses on what can go right, and how you can be
            successful, and that people will respond positively to you.Sometimes before you know it, you have been triggered emotionally, you then make interpretations about what
            is going on and potential dangers, based on this reactive emotion – based on past experience (derivative
            from your childhood). Thus, you have gone into “wrong thinking\". When this happens, it’s important to
            awaken out of your automated pattern and shift into right thinking mode, as noted above.Remember: your primitive gestalt pattern is never correct – even when it is presenting facts. That’s because
            it comes from an undermining and unsupportive perspective.

action_step:
Today hold the intention to be in “Right Thinking\" mode. And when you are not – to notice this and shift
            into right thinker."
journal_entry: Write about your tendency for wrong thinking as well as your ability to be a “Right thinker.\"

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: How much were you in “Right thinking\" mode the last two days? Taking This Path will
            lead to health and success!
quote: "You become what you believe." Oprah Winfrey

step_of_the_day.title:
Belief is very powerful. Use it today to support your resilience and success. Create a positive, supportive
            belief today (Pillar #5 and all the rest)
step_of_the_day.content:
I’m reminded of the history of breaking the “4-minute mile.\" For years, so many athletes had tried and
            failed to run a mile in less than four minutes that people believed it was a physical impossibility. In
            fact, even scientists weighted in to say it couldn’t be done. The world record was 4 minutes and 1.3
            seconds, set by Gunder Hagg of Sweden in 1945.Then in May of 1954 under less-than-ideal conditions, Roger Bannister, a British medical student ran the
            mile in 3 minutes and 59.4 seconds. With the mystique broken, 8 other athletes broke the 4-minute mile
            within the year. Today, over 1,400 athletes have broken this mark!What does this say about the power of belief? What does this say about how your beliefs shape your life,
            your achievements and your success? Beliefs open doors and break down barriers to achievements.

action_step:
Today, identify one of your beliefs that holds you back. One way that you believe you can’t, believe it will
            be difficult, believe some barrier will get in your way? And reframe this by thinking how it’s possible, how
            it can be done and how you will give 100% to achieve it.
journal_entry: Write about your own beliefs and how they either support you or get in your way.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you identified a belief that holds you back and shifted into a more positive
            belief – that’s walking on The Path.
quote: “You are not born with beliefs; you learn them\" Stephen Sideroff.

step_of_the_day.title:
Strengthening a new internal belief framework. Identify a belief that would support positive results
            (Pillars #3 & 5)
step_of_the_day.content:
You did not decide on your beliefs; they were instilled in you. That sounds like you had no decision making
            in the process and it’s true. Fritz Perls used the term, “introjected\" to describe the process. He would
            say, when you are young you take in the messages, lessons of your childhood – without chewing them - and you
            “swallow them whole\". Then, in therapy, you bring them up and for the first time you chew on them. And
            decide if you like the way they taste. If you don’t (if the lesson doesn’t support you), you spit it out. If
            you like it, you digest/take it in.Your beliefs are not automatically right. As adults you can examine the beliefs running your life. You take
            control over your life by independently deciding on the most effective beliefs as your operating system.

action_step:
Identify a belief – about yourself, about others or about the world – that would result in you being less
            fearful and less defensive. For example, “I am competent\", or “People generally like me\", or “It’s okay to
            make a mistake, that I then learn from\". When you make this shift, you will reduce your stress, enhance
            your resilience and think and perform better.
journal_entry: Write about the belief you want to strengthen.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Identifying and supporting the development of a positive and constructive belief
            puts you on The Path to Resilience and Success.
quote:
“When you ground yourself in positive beliefs you are the creator of your life\" Stephen
              Sideroff.

step_of_the_day.title: Identify another belief that would support positive results in your life (Pillars #3 & 5 & 8)
step_of_the_day.content:
I’ve been focusing on how your beliefs direct your feelings, thinking and … your life. I’ve also been
            pointing out that you were not born with these beliefs, but instead they developed as a result of adapting
            to your childhood environment. The result of locking in your beliefs to your childhood environment is that
            it keeps you tied to those lessons, and that way of life. Even if you were fortunate enough to have a
            “good\" childhood, with loving parents, you still have been exposed to all their anxieties, and their
            unfinished emotional business.The most important fact is that your belief system was not decided by you. And now you have the opportunity
            to correct that. You achieve this by beginning to choose a set of beliefs that help you be more effective in
            life, and less prone to fear, anxiety and procrastination. A strategy in which you are more likely to follow
            through and embrace life.

action_step:
Today continue with a focus on a positive belief that supports your success. A positive belief, in alignment
            with “Right thinking\" sends you in a direction that increases your chances of getting the results you want.
            This might be “I am good at what I do\", “It doesn’t have to be perfect for it to work out\", “The world
            will send back positive energy if I start off with positive energy\".
journal_entry: Write about your commitment to a positive belief system.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Any effort to shift into a positive belief yesterday put you on The Path.
quote:
“You can ground yourself in the lessons of your past, or in your future vision. One holds you back and the
            other propels you forward\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title: How to start your day on The Path. Make your first choices of the day, the right choices (Pillars #1-9)
step_of_the_day.content:
It’s true that you learn from experience. And it makes sense to base your expectations on lessons of the
            past. Unfortunately, this is also a way to stay rooted in the past and continually recreate the results of
            the past.If you want to experience breakthroughs in your life and experience different and more rewarding results,
            it’s necessary to pull up the anchor lodged in your past. One way of doing this is to identify and paint a
            picture of your healthy and positive vision of your future. By focusing on this vision, allowing it to
            excite and support you, you can better let go of the anchor.Optimal functioning which I refer to as being on The Path, is supported by starting your day grounding
            yourself in your healthy vision of the future. This might be a strong and healthy relationship, better
            health, or a goal you set in your career or finances. From this perspective you then identify what you are
            committed to creating today.

action_step:
Hold a mental image of your vision: where you want to be a year from now. Experience this mental process in
            as much detail as possible – sights, sounds, smells, taste and feelings. Allow this image to lift you up and
            motivate you for the day. Next, look at your day and ask, “what am I committed to causing to support my
            vision, that wasn’t going to happen without my effort?\" Make this your goal for the day.
journal_entry: Write about your vision for one year from now, and how much you are committed to causing it to happen.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you focused on your vision and took an action step toward making it a reality,
            that is beautiful! And it put you on The Path. If you didn’t identify a vision, or thought you don’t or
            cannot have a vision, that took you off The Path. You will be somewhere, a year from now. Without
            identifying your vision, you are wandering in the dessert.
quote: “Behavioral (and mental) addictions are just as harmful as drug addictions\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Addressing your “negative addiction\" with “negative sobriety.\" Identify your thoughts and words that are
            negative, and commit to “negative sobriety\" (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
Words, just like thoughts, matter. Language is one representation of you, your belief system and where you
            ground yourself. “Right thinking\" is a way of sending yourself in the supportive, constructive direction,
            instead of handicapping your actions that negative thinking creates.

action_step:
Today, commit to “negative sobriety\". This means that you don’t touch a “glass\" of negativity. This would
            include negative thoughts and negative words or phrases.
journal_entry: Write about your relationship with positive thoughts and beliefs.

review_and_appreciate: Review and Appreciate: Were you sober with respect to negativity yesterday? That put you on The Path.
quote: “Stress is not necessarily bad, as long as you make sure to recover from it\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Recover from your stresses and hassles today. Take control over the activation of your nervous system by
            recovering after each stress (Pillar #4)
step_of_the_day.content:
There are stresses that can be considered “good\" stresses, such as getting a promotion or having a baby.
            Hans Selye, referred to these as “eustress\". There are also stresses, referred to as distress, that can be
            particularly harmful physically. Stresses that you don’t feel in control over, stresses that are dangerous
            and stresses that are chronic are negative stresses. All stresses activate your nervous system.It’s possible to cope well with all stresses. The important way of optimal coping is to a. remember to
            disengage from the stress after it’s over, and b. to engage in a recovery process.When a stress is over it’s important to consciously tell yourself, you are now safe and can relax.Recovery is facilitated by taking a few minutes to practice a relaxation exercise.

action_step:
Notice the stresses in your life today. Make a conscious effort to let go when each stress is over – saying,
            “The stress and any associated dangers are over. I am safe for the moment and can let down my guard and
            relax. Next, take between 5 and 15 minutes to engage in a relaxation/breathing/visualization exercise. You
            can go to my website: www.DrStephenSIderoff.com to download a free audio exercise.
journal_entry: Write about how well you let go after a stress is over.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you did the two steps recommended yesterday – telling yourself the stress is
            over, when you are finished with a stress, and taking a few minutes to let go – you are on The Path.
quote: “You can be anchored in your past, or by your future vision of yourself\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Be guided today by your vision, not your story/history. What is your vision of yourself? Let it guide you
            today (Pillar #1 & 5)
step_of_the_day.content:
Working hard to
            heal yourself, to feel good, to get ahead, to be healthy and successful is like climbing up a mountain. Each
            effort, each hard fought and won “Hand hold or foot hold\" that you take and make, is an accomplishment. Too
            often you work hard, do your best, but feel like progress is so difficult to come by.If you look closely, what happens after your big efforts and struggles to reach a new hold with one hand,
            your other hand comes along and digs the dirt out from under that hard-fought advance. This is because you
            are anchored to the lessons of your past; to those limitations – your Primitive Gestalt Pattern, and its
            spokesperson – your internal voice.One way of addressing this is to focus on your vision, your image of yourself, as you want to be – and are
            committed to being – sometime in the future. And then, link your behavior, link your thinking to this
            image/vision.

action_step:
Today, identify your vision of yourself sometime in the future. Take time to fully embody this image – feel
            it as deeply as possible. And then, from this grounding, experience your day.
journal_entry: Write about your vision of yourself, as you want to experience yourself.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Are you supporting yourself by visioning how you see yourself in the future. See you
            on The Path.
quote: "Dream big and dare to fail." Norman Vaughan

step_of_the_day.title:
What’s the price you are willing to pay to achieve success and happiness? Any step forward has its risks.
            What risk are you willing to take? (Pillars # 1 & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
When the brains of risk takers are examined, it shows that their brains are wired differently. They can be
            ready to walk a tightrope across the Grand Canyon, and the fear centers do not light up, as they would do
            for anyone else. For most of us, risks and dangers are at the least, uncomfortable.It is helpful to make the decision that you are willing to pay a price for good things in your life and to
            feel good. I’m not talking about risking life and limb, I’m talking about the risk of being judged, the risk
            of making a mistake and not being perfect, or the risk of feeling uncomfortable. These are what I refer to
            as necessary risks to being on The Path. Where the rewards are greater than these risks.

action_step:
Determine what risk you are willing to take to move closer to one of your goals – today. And then take that
            risk.
journal_entry:
Write about those things – judgments and feelings - that get in your way, and what you are willing to
            experience in order to go beyond these obstacles.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you take a reasonable risk to move closer to one of your goals? That put you on
            The Path.
quote: “Choosing your perspective and your vision will lead to success\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title: Today, flex your perspective. Choose a perspective that can support your success (Pillar #8)
step_of_the_day.content:
Many years ago, sports psychologist and amateur weightlifter, Charles A. Garfield, during a world sports
            competition, met after hours with a team from eastern Europe in a local gym. He was there to experience,
            firsthand, some amazing claims of huge improvements in lifting in conjunction with visualization. Garfield,
            who hadn’t lifted for a while, had a personal best of 250 pounds. He suggested that they should start at
            about 225 pounds for the experiment.Prior to doing his lift, the team coach took him through a 15-minute visualization that Garfield described
            as leaving him feeling refreshed and energized, and then had him lift the weight. With surprising ease, he
            lifted the bar bell only to be told after he achieved this, that he actually lifted 285 pounds!Your mind and how you use it, can produce amazing results.

action_step:
Today, as you approach your day, and each task, take a moment to prepare. During this preparation, visualize
            taking the action from a place of confidence and positive energy. Imagine completing the task successfully
            with the highest level of achievement.
journal_entry: Write about your commitment to preparing for each of your actions by visualizing success.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you experience a benefit from shifting your perspective into a more positive
            vision of yourself and future? That put you on The Path
quote: “Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.\" Oscar Wilde

step_of_the_day.title:
Today experience the benefits of being authentic. Hold the intention today to be yourself (Pillars #1 &
            2)
step_of_the_day.content:
A primary source of anxiety is the fear of making a mistake or looking foolish out in the world. “Will I get
            it right?\" “Will aspects of my true self be revealed, resulting in me looking silly, wrong or inadequate?\"
            These fears hold you back and can cause you to be tentative. These fears have their origins in
            self-judgement. It’s time to accept yourself and be willing to project your true self out into the world.
            Who you really are is what will excite others.

action_step:
Two steps today: Step one is – coming from your healthy internal parent – be accepting of yourself and to
            decide that you have something to offer the world, and step two is to be yourself, and to appreciate
            yourself for simply being who you are!
journal_entry: Write about who you are and what you have to offer to others.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you come from your authentic self yesterday? How did it feel? That put you on
            The Path.
quote:
“Don’t walk in front of me… I may not follow 
 Don’t walk behind me… I may not lead 
 Walk beside me… just be my friend\"Albert Camus

step_of_the_day.title:
Connect authentically with a friend today. Allow yourself to be vulnerable in your contact with a friend
            today (Pillar #2)
step_of_the_day.content:
I talk a lot about how easy it is to go about your day on “automatic\". This is when you act from a place of
            habit and without intention. It’s only when you pay attention and are present to the moment that life is
            lived in technicolor.Today, bring this concept of being in the moment, of being aware and present, and living with intention, to
            one of your relationships.

action_step:
Connect from a place of caring and vulnerability with one of your friends today. Use this connection as an
            opportunity to show more of yourself while asking questions that support a fuller expression from your
            friend. Be in the moment and appreciate the connection.
journal_entry: Write about your typical style of relating to your friends. Are you able to show your true self?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: What did you experience in your connection with friends yesterday? Loving
            relationships is important in feeling safe and thus being able to let down your guard. It’s only when you
            allow yourself to be vulnerable can your body go into recovery mode – a key to resilience. Live on The Path.
quote: “It’s difficult to experience true thriving in life, if you are too busy surviving\" Stephen Sideroff

step_of_the_day.title:
Are you living in life’s top half or bottom half? Where you place your focus determines how you live. Choose
            the top half. (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.quote: “To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.\"― Oscar Wilde
step_of_the_day.content:
It’s difficult to experience true thriving in life if you are focused on surviving! If you consider the full
            range of life’s experience – and then find the midpoint – everything below is about survival, while
            everything above is about fully living in happiness. You don’t consciously make the choice, but many of you
            dwell in the lower half of this range of life.If you start your day wondering what can go wrong – you are choosing the lower half. If your unspoken goal
            is for things to simply be OK, you are dwelling below the midline. If you are afraid to expect good things
            to happen because you don’t want to be disappointed, you are living below the line.To live above the line, you first must make this choice. “I want to thrive, not just survive.\" “I want and
            I deserve to be happy and have good things in my life!\" These are decisions that start you focusing above
            the line.

action_step:
Today choose to live above the line. Think about what can go right. Expect good things in your day. Focus
            and look for today to be a day in which you experience joy and happiness. Make the choice.
journal_entry: Write about how you focus above or below the line.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you lived any part of your day yesterday “Above the line\" that’s great. And it
            put you on The Path.

step_of_the_day.title:
Choose where you go today. Today take the challenge and be the driver of your life and actions (Pillars # 5
            & 9)
step_of_the_day.quote: “You have brains in your head.You have feet in your shoes.You can steer yourself any direction you choose.You're on your own.And you know what you know.And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go...\"― Dr. Seuss, Oh, the Places You'll Go!
step_of_the_day.content:
You may be moving fast. You may be tiring yourself out. But are you heading in the direction that’s best for
            you? Are you choosing your direction, or going where you “should\" be going?

action_step: Today, pause, and consciously decide what actions truly serve you. And then follow through.
journal_entry: Write about The Path that you are on. Are you doing what you want to be doing?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you pause to determine if you were going in the direction you want to be going
            in? You want The Path to be Your Path.
quote: “Everything you can imagine is real.\" Pablo Picasso

step_of_the_day.title:
Quantum physics tells us that observation, focus, and attention turn possibility into reality. Today
            determine what you want, focus on it and its possibility (Pillar #3)
step_of_the_day.content:
Quantum physics has been with us for over 100 years, yet in many respects it’s still a mystery. It’s still a
            concept that is difficult to grasp. One of the main core research findings is that on the microscopic level,
            the physical Universe only comes into being upon observation. Until there is the observation, there are only
            possibilities. What does this say for how to live your life?It tells me that if I don’t think something is possible – or I focus on how it is not possible – I won’t
            bring it into reality. On the other hand, if I do focus on the possibility of what I want - to happen – my
            focus then facilitates bringing it into reality.

action_step:
What do you want to bring into reality? Decide to focus on how it can happen, how it can be possible. Make
            this the focus of your day today – and then take steps on The Path in this direction.
journal_entry: Write about what you want and how you see it happening.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you focused on what’s possible, what you want to bring into reality and took
            steps in that direction, what did you experience? That approach put you on The Path.
quote: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.\" George Bernard Shaw

step_of_the_day.title:
Choose the energy that is most likely to yield the results you want. Change your energy, change your life
            (Pillars # 1, 6, & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Your views, attitude and approach are embodied in the energy you bring to each moment of your life. This is
            evident in your posture, your facial expression, and your voice. You project this energy into your life,
            into your actions and thus into the results you get.The good news is that you don’t have to be a victim or slave to the energy you have projected up to this
            point. You can make a new choice and choose a different quality of energy you “create\" (as George says) in
            this and every new moment.

action_step:
Choose positive vision of yourself, over past lessons.Choosing the quality of energy you embody isn’t about faking it. It’s about creating it from aspects of who
            you are, but typically ignore or deny. You have power. You have knowledge. You have savvy. Connect with
            these and other positive aspects of yourself today. And transform the energy you generate and project.
journal_entry:
Write about the positive energy inside and how you are projecting it into your present moments. Also write
            about whatever difficulty you have doing this.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you took the challenge yesterday and shifted your energy, what did you notice
            about your day? That put you on The Path.
quote: “What you're supposed to do when you don't like a thing is change it. If you can't change it, change the way you think about it. Don't complain.\" ― Maya Angelou

step_of_the_day.title:
Make this a day of empowerment by taking full responsibility. Hold the intention to be the source of
            everything that happens in your life today (Pillar #9)
step_of_the_day.content:
There are always reasons why something does or doesn’t happen. And we can always come up with excuses. There
            are always others or circumstances to blame. The point of today’s step is not that these things are not
            true, but that focusing on them doesn’t help you get the results you want. The best path for success, The
            Path for success is to focus back on yourself, learn from your experience – what you can do different or
            better - recommit, and re-engage. No Blame!

action_step: Today, take full responsibility for every result you get. Be open to the lessons this shows you.
journal_entry: Write about the results you are getting and how you are taking full responsibility for your life.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you took full responsibility for everything in your life yesterday, that put you
            on The Path.
quote: “You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.\" Mae West

step_of_the_day.title:
Notice how much you are guided by the fear of what can go wrong. How much do you live from a survival
            perspective? (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
What’s your number one goal in life? Instinctually it’s to survive. You don’t have a say in the matter, the
            imperative is buried deep in the most primitive parts of your brain and nervous system. But this dominance
            can hold you back and can also get corrupted by lessons of childhood.These lessons get internalized and held by your internal parent, or what I’ve been referring to as the
            spokesperson of your Primitive Gestalt Pattern. This voice wants to protect you at all costs. But it judges
            this need to protect, based on an outmoded and typically negative set of judgments about you and your
            “lacks.\" When you have a more negative self-view, there is a greater need to protect. And a larger view of
            danger and what can go wrong.

action_step:
Today, notice how the above process plays itself out: fear of what can go wrong, fear of being exposed, as
            well as how you hold yourself back to avoid negative outcomes. And identify your negative self-judgements
            that drive this thinking.
journal_entry: Write about

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: What did you notice about your negative self-judgments and fears from the last step?
            This awareness helps put you on The Path.
quote: “Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.\" ― Mahatma Gandhi

step_of_the_day.title:
How would you deal with your self-judgments if you were to die tomorrow? Tackle your day today, and your
            fears, by imagining this is your last day on earth (Pillars #4, 5, 6, and 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Dear friends;If you have been using my daily “Steps\" and have been missing them this past week – sorry for the lapse.
            Perhaps you went back and reviewed earlier ones in their place. Today, I’d like to follow up on my last step
            about what holds you back: self-judgments and fears. One way of putting your priorities in their proper
            order and help you take action is to imagine that you are living the last day of your life. This really puts
            things in perspective.

action_step:
Today come from the perspective of only having today to take action. Allow this framing of your day to help
            you let go of self-judgments, and push through fear, to take important actions in your life.
journal_entry: Write about your courage to take difficult steps.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did you take the challenge I gave you yesterday? To imagine living the day as if
            it’s the last day of your life. When you come from this perspective it adds urgency to your actions. If you
            did, and it supported you taking difficult steps, that put you on The Path.
quote: “I don’t believe that people are afraid of the unknown. I believe that people are afraid of the known repeating itself.\" - Michael Strasner

step_of_the_day.title:
Today take action from the perspective of creating a new reality for yourself. Today decide the person you
            want to be (Pillar #1, 5, & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
It’s common to believe that what stops you from taking action is not knowing what to expect. Similarly, it’s
            being afraid of the unknown – that which hasn’t yet happened. However, the fear can be reframed: it’s afraid
            that you will get the same results as in the past, or that you will be lacking in some quality that held you
            back in the past.These perspectives keep you stuck in the past and stuck with the results of the past. It’s like you are
            taking an anchor and throwing it into your past and hooking all the negativity you are trying to “grow\"
            away from – or grow out of.

action_step:
Today take a more progressive approach that is anchored in your optimal image of yourself: who you are
            capable of being. And what your vision is of yourself in the future. Throw the anchor forward and allow it
            to pull you in the right direction. Today take action by being how you want to show up being (courageous,
            passionate, competent, focused, giving 100%). Complete this process by visualizing, and coming from, the
            best version of your future self.
journal_entry: Write about how you see yourself in the future, from an optimistic and positive perspective.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you took yesterday’s challenge to not drag your past into your present, but
            instead to choose a more effective framework of deciding how you want to show up in your actions, that put
            you on The Path.
quote: “When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.\" Helen Keller

step_of_the_day.title:
Identify one regret, one mistake you keep dwelling on, one loss you continue to grieve, and let go. Today
            let go of a regret or loss that distracts you from focusing your energy more creatively (Pillar #6)
step_of_the_day.content:
“Don’t cry over spilt milk,\" and similar phrases point to the wasted energy of staying in grief after a
            mistake, loss or disappointment. But that’s only half, and the smaller half of the issue. Focusing on what
            didn’t happen, what should have happened, what could have happened, distracts from a refocus on new
            opportunities and where the possibilities will still be found.

action_step:
Today, identify where you are wasting your energy by continuing to focus on what went wrong, or who wronged
            you. Decide to let go – not to let the person who wronged you “off the hook\" but to let YOU off the hook.
journal_entry: Write about stuff from the past that continues to bother you. How can you do some more letting go?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you took the time yesterday to address one piece of unfinished business – and let
            go – that put you on The Path.
quote: “A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.\" Elbert Hubbard

step_of_the_day.title:
Pillar #2 of Resilience and Success is your relationship with others. Today hold the intention of connecting
            in a meaningful way with someone you are close to. Enhance your feelings of belonging today (Pillar #2)
step_of_the_day.content:
Paul Simon sang, “I am a rock, I am an Island. And a rock feels no pain, and an Island never cries.\" And of
            course, the pain and tears he is referring to only go underground and fuel anger and depression. And most of
            all, it denies a basic need of all of us; the need to belong and feel connected. The satisfaction of these
            needs helps physically – it supports optimal nervous system balance and resilience - and it helps
            emotionally and even mentally.

action_step:
Today make contact with someone close to you. But don’t just ask them how they are doing, see if you can go
            deeper with your conversation. Let them know how important they are in your life. Express appreciation and
            gratitude. And then notice how this makes you feel, and how it supports your own self-image.
journal_entry: Write about the deep connections you have and how they make you feel.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Since the last step, have you connected intimately with someone? If so, how did it
            feel and how did it support you? That put you on The Path.
quote: “I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.\" Thomas A. Edison

step_of_the_day.title:
Today, engage in the optimal way of learning and developing. Bringing in key ingredients into how you grow
            in a healthy way. And what have you learned during this year of the “365 Steps on The Path of Resilience and
            Success\"? (Pillars #5 & 6)
step_of_the_day.content:
Wow! We are at the last few steps on a year-long journey of developing healthy and effective ways of being
            resilient and successful, particularly during this global pandemic. Let’s take a few minutes to reflect and
            identify some of the important “steps\" or lessons and actions that have benefitted you over this past
            year.As you review, there might be the tendency to focus on how you didn’t follow through – the negative. The
            healthy way of experiencing your life and performance is to first appreciate what you did right, what you
            learned. Next is to identify what behaviors didn’t support you or where you made mistakes. From that
            awareness your goal would be to commit to how you can think and act more effectively in the future.

action_step:
Identify some of the life and resilience lessons you took in, over this last year of doing the “Steps\"
            program. At the same time, also note what didn’t work; what you didn’t follow through with. Make sure not to
            judge yourself, but instead, how can you hold the intention of doing it more effectively moving forward – on
            The Path?
journal_entry: Write about you own growth process with acceptance, compassion and support.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you took time the last two days to acknowledge and remember some of the lessons
            of the “Steps\" program that put you on The Path. If you also identified (without judgment) what didn’t
            work, where you didn’t follow through or what you ignored – and then recommitted to more effectively
            following through and having the courage to face some of the difficult steps – that put you on The Path.
quote: “Happiness is not something readymade. It comes from your own actions.\" Dalai Lama XIV

step_of_the_day.title:
Take an action today to support your happiness. Make sure that one of your goals is to be happy and to live
            “above the line\" (Pillars #3 & 6)
step_of_the_day.content:
Sometimes you are so busy with what must get done, stresses and distractions, that being happy slips to the
            bottom of your “to do\" list – or doesn’t even make it onto the list. The Dalai Lama has said that the
            purpose of life is to be happy. And while you can identify many other purposes to your life, I would suggest
            that happiness, at least be included.I refer to happiness as living “above the line\". What line am I referring to? It’s the line that separates
            enjoyment of life – above the line, from what must get done, and just trying to reach “ok\" or no disasters
            – below the line. It’s the dividing line between thriving and surviving.

action_step:
Today think happiness and think “Above the line\" as you plan your day. In amongst all that “must\" get
            done, schedule some time for an activity that will bring you enjoyment and happiness. That will bring a
            smile to your lips.
journal_entry: What’s your relationship with happiness and where do you spend most of your time – above or below the line?

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Were you aware of living “Above the Line\" yesterday? Did you take action to be
            above the line; action to take responsibility for your happiness – yesterday? If you did, that put you on
            The Path – two days before the completion of the “365 Steps on The Path of Resilience and Success.\"
quote:
“Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the
            present.\" - Bill Keane

step_of_the_day.title:
Decide and then commit to how you want to be present today. How much of the day today are you able to be in
            the present? Go for it. (Pillar #7)
step_of_the_day.content:
When your mind is occupied with the past, you don’t have choice. When your mind is in the future, you don’t’
            have “response-ability\". You are in the reactive mode instead of being in creation. Your growth, learning,
            effectiveness and your power, come from how much time you spend being fully present.Let’s take this one step further, because you can also decide how you want to be present. You can be present
            and resentful. You can be present and stressed. You can be present and feel like external events are
            dictating your behavior. Or, you can be present and fully responsible for your attitude and actions – the
            creator of your day and your life!

action_step:
Hold the intention today to be fully in the present, and when you are not present, to notice as quickly as
            you can and without judgement, guide yourself back to the here and now. Since it’s easy to get distracted by
            “stuff\", find some way to remind yourself to bring yourself into the present moment – such as setting your
            smartphone periodically throughout the day, or using cues, such as each time you enter a doorway.Second: commit to taking full responsibility for your attitude (a positive one, of course) and being the
            source of your day and holding the intention for creating a masterpiece out of the day.And let’s do this for two days, before I send out the last and 365th Step.
journal_entry: Write about what takes you away, distracts you from the present.

review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: The last step was to hold the intention to live your life in the present moment, and
            to do it in as optimal a way as you can. Give yourself credit for your efforts to follow this “Step,\" and
            renew this commitment moving forward, in order to continue to be on The Path.
quote: “You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams.\" - Dr. Seuss

step_of_the_day.title: Today live and act from a place of love. Ground your day, thoughts and actions from a place of love (Pillars #1, 2, 3, & 6).
step_of_the_day.content:
There are so many reasons to ground yourself in a place of love. For starters, it makes sense from a health
            perspective. Love and other positive emotions such as gratitude, actually help your heart and your nervous
            system function better. It fosters greater balance between the two branches of your nervous system and
            encourages greater heart rate variability, which supports healthy heart function. I’ve discussed this in
            previous steps.From an emotional perspective, going into a place of love is emotionally soothing. In my own experience,
            when I’ve been in emotionally painful places, focusing on loving feelings – including loving myself – has
            shifted my emotional state. Helping me feel a sense of relief.And finally, when I come from a place of love – even in business relationships – it yields much more
 beneficial results.
